decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to control the board early on, followed by powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, this deck looks to close out games quickly. Static Prison helps to disrupt opponent's strategies, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a powerful finisher. With a mix of creature aggression and spell disruption, this deck is designed to apply pressure from multiple angles and secure victories efficiently.

This deck focuses on using spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand back from the graveyard for a powerful instant reanimation combo. By utilizing cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Priest of Fell Rites to set up the graveyard, and Ephemerate to protect your creatures, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with big threats. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to control the game while you set up your combo. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly reanimate powerful creatures and take control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage as quickly as possible to win the game. It utilizes cheap spells and creatures to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and a potential late-game advantage. The deck aims to consistently push damage through each turn and end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using control spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also efficiently removing threats on the board. It utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. The creatures in the deck are used to pressure the opponent and provide additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the necessary resources. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing various counterspells and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards that allow for card selection to ensure the player has the right answers at the right time. The deck includes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure and close out the game once the opponent's threats have been dealt with. The mana base is designed to support the deck's various color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful control spells, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana to quickly bring out massive threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler. With the help of cards like Through the Breach and Sowing Mycospawn, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its high-powered creatures while also having access to powerful removal options like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command. The deck focuses on controlling the game and dominating the battlefield with its Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. By using cards like Fell the Profane, Necrodominance, and Soul Spike, the deck can easily remove threats and gain valuable card advantage. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with Malakir Rebirth and March of Wretched Sorrow, while using Phyrexian Tower and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to generate additional mana. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while utilizing low-cost creatures like Gravecrawler and Boggart Trawler to constantly apply pressure. The inclusion of cards like Unearth and Warren Soultrader allows for graveyard recursion to maintain a strong board presence. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells in order to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to consistently and efficiently combo off using Underworld Breach and various untap effects like Twiddle and Hidden Strings to generate infinite mana with Lotus Field. The deck utilizes Wish and Consign to Memory to find necessary pieces and interact with the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through a loop that generates enough mana to cast a game-winning spell, such as Planar Genesis or The One Ring. The deck also includes card selection and filtering spells to find combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures and then utilizing cards like Unearth and Chthonian Nightmare to bring them back to the battlefield for repeated aggressive attacks. Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Marionette Apprentice provide additional value by generating tokens or sacrificing creatures for added advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of threats and disruption, taking advantage of the synergy between graveyard recursion and aggressive creature strategies.
